text:
League 1
Nice - Reims: Aiglons leave again
OGC Nice breathes and wins 2-0 on his turf against Stade de Reims for the 12th day of Ligue 1 with goals from Cyprien and Herelle.
03 Nov 2019, 17:58 by Antoine Chirat



Alexis Claude-Maurice, Kasper Dolberg and Adam OunasAlexis Claude-Maurice, Kasper Dolberg and Adam Ounas side by side, main recruits of OGC Nice version Ineos.Icon Sport



Alexis Claude-Maurice- Previous club: FC Lorient- Transfer allowance: 13 million eurosIcon Sport



Adam Ounas- Naples- ‚Ç¨ 2.50 million paying loanIcon Sport



Stanley Nsoki - Paris Saint-Germain - ‚Ç¨ 12.5 million Icon Sport



Hichem Boudaoui- Paradou AC- ‚Ç¨ 4 M. Icon Sport



Kh√©phren Thuram- AS Monaco- Free transferIcon Sport



Kasper Dolberg - Ajax Amsterdam - ‚Ç¨ 20.50 million Icon Sport

Nice: all recruits of the transfer window 2019




After a long series of 6 games without a win (five defeats, one draw), OGC Nice is slowly coming out of the water with this victory against the Stade de Reims at home. Cyprien and Herelle are the scorers side Eagles. The R√©mois evolved during much of the game at 10 after the early expulsion of Doumbia (26th). In the standings, Patrick Vieira's men are now 12th with 16 points while their opponents remain in 7th place with 18 units on the clock.
